txt.en: 'Let's get you a weapon and some combat practice first...and hope you won't need to use it.'
After you collected your weapon, a great quaking shook the very mountain above you. Gimli son of Glóin and Gormr are startled.
Gimli wishes for you to prove your strength before he allows you to follow him into the mine to rescue the workers. You never know what evils may appear when the mountains tremble.
'Leave me be!'
'Stay your hand, beast!'
'You are a [placeholder], are you not, [placeholder]? You must help Gimli!'
'And to think, I wanted to seek adventure with my father on the way to the Lonely Mountain. Adventure decided to come to me instead!\n\n'I think I've had my fill of it for quite a while....'
<rgb=#FF0000>NOTE: The files you need to continue your adventures in Middle-earth should finish downloading shortly. Thank you for your patience!</rgb>
'Don't dawdle. Go on into the Silver Deep and lend Gimli a hand!'

'You found the body of a dwarf, did you? Do you hear that, Gormr? I wonder if [placeholder] has come upon Skorgrím, lying under the collapsed ruins where he was smitten by an Elf-warrior named Talagan.\n\n'But that is a matter for years long passed. My business is with Thorin today. Gormr may look into the grave of his ancestor while he is Steward of this land in Thorin's absence.'

'The halls of my father and my grandfather beckon to me. I will claim my gold and my birthright as King under the Mountain. No worm shall deny what is mine!\n\n'Ah, to hold the Arkenstone once more....'
'Tvistur! Come on, it's time for the ceremony.'

'You there! You are a miner here, are you not? Tell me your name then, my good Dwarf.

'[placeholder]...a fine name. I am Gandalf, if you do not know me. I am also Gandalf if you DO know me...Gandalf the Grey.

'Now, will you humour an old man and walk with me for a spell? I am quite tired and could use the company.'
'Glóin and the dwarves will not succeed at the Lonely Mountain unless they bring a burglar.'

'The halls of my father and my grandfather beckon to me. I will claim my gold and my birthright as King under the Mountain. No worm shall deny what is mine!\n\n'Ah, to hold the Arkenstone once more....'
'He doesn't listen, and so I will have to give things a little nudge. You see, we need another party member for the company that departs for the Lonely Mountain. Thirteen won't do.'
It is plain to see that this once-living troll of flesh and blood has been turned to stone by the light of the sun.

'We've got to clear out all these miners. A shaking tunnel is never a good sign, and we could even feel it outside!\n\n'Quickly, [placeholder]! You take this passage straight ahead, and I'll go off into the side passage.'
'All right, young one...you have dilly-dallied long enough. You ought to get back to work now. Hasn't your foreman given you enough to do?'

'Have you equipped your weapon yet, [placeholder]? Quickly now -- practice with me before you go into the mine. You never know what evils may appear when the mountains tremble!' 

<rgb=#00FF00>ACCESSING YOUR INVENTORY: Press 'i' to open your inventory to see the weapon or left-click on the bag icons on the bottom of your screen.</rgb>

<rgb=#00FF00>EQUIPPING YOUR WEAPON: Right-click on the weapon in your inventory to equip it. This will replace the flimsy weapon you currently have equipped.</rgb>

<rgb=#FF0000>ADVICE: You should equip your best weapon before attempting to engage in combat.</rgb>
'So we have the order to clear out? Good -- if I didn't know better, I'd think there was a troll romping around in the mountain.\n\n'There is one miner left down this way. Let's go fetch him.'
'The mountain sure is grumpy today!'
'We must be quick. I don't know how long Gimli can keep that troll busy before the beast overpowers him.\n\n'Follow me!'
'Aye, aye...it's best to leave. Them cave-claws have weakened the mine with their nosey burrowing.'
'An order to leave? Good! It sounds like a troll is on the loose.'
'My thanks to you, Master Gandalf!'
Fight!
'It's a troll!'
'Roar! You don't scare me, troll!'
'Get out of our mine!'
'Ah, here comes the other dwarf I was sent to retrieve!'
'He should be just ahead! I can hear his mining pick.'
'The side-path has crumbled in the earthquake! Tvistur! Tvistur!'
'Excellent! Now equip the weaponry and go and strike the practice dummies over there!'
The entrance to the Silver Deep Mine stands before you.\n\nGimli wishes to meet you inside the unstable mine, where you will help him get the miners out. You should walk into the doorway.
'Tvistur should be just up ahead.'
'Here, you should find something in my pack there you can use.'
The miners can be found throughout the mine, hard at work.\n\nA quaking of the earth has troubled Gormr, the new leader. He and Gimli want this mine clear so that nobody gets hurt.

Follow Foreman Otur to get help for Gimli.\n\nWhile you were trying to call Tvistur to Thorin's ceremony, he broke through a wall, unleashing a troll. The troll slew him, then chased after Gimli. You should follow Otur and see how you can get help for Gimli.
The new tunnel excavated by Tvistur now yawns before you.\n\nYou should go down the tunnel to try to head off the troll as it pursues Gimli.
You seem to have uncovered some old ruins, apparently from ancient Elf-structures. A body lies among them.
'We've had no end to the beasts here, especially around the Elf-ruins.'
'Ho now! That can't be good....'

Fight your way deeper into the Silver Deep to help Gimli.\n\nAs you followed Otur, he discovered that the door that led to the bridge had been damaged by the troll's attacks. He asked you to go and help Gimli while he went off to get more help.
'I wonder how long the troll has been roaming around these old Elf-ruins.'
'Come on, this way.'
You have made your way to Gimli. Help him, if you can!
'I wish Tvistur had not been so careless!'
'You'll find the entrance up around that bend.'
Gandalf the Grey, a wizard accompanying Thorin's Company, saved Gimli from the troll.
Gandalf the Grey, a wizard accompanying Thorin's Company, saved Gimli from the troll.
'Come on, [placeholder], this way!'
Gandalf the Grey, a wizard accompanying Thorin's Company, saved Gimli from the troll.
'I'll break this dratted lock....'
Get Ready...
'There...that got it!'
'Please help Gimli.'
'Watch out for cave-claws, as well. This mine is beset with perils today!'
Approach the old man who stands near <rgb=#00FF00>(Move forward by pressing W)</rgb>
travel_exit (info)
'I'll go get help!'
Talk to the wizard <rgb=#00FF00>(Right-click on Gandalf to interact)</rgb>
'They are a confident bunch, but I worry for their success. We must convince them to bring more help.'
'Be quick, go help Gimli!'
Walk with Gandalf and listen to him for a bit <rgb=#00FF00>(Move forward by pressing W; A and D to turn)</rgb>
Follow Gandalf and listen to his musings
Talk to Gormr, the new Steward of Thorin's Hall
Collect your equipment from the satchel near the door <rgb=#00FF00>(Right-click on glowing items to loot)</rgb>
'Just a moment....'
Collect your equipment from the satchel near the door <rgb=#00FF00>(Right-click on glowing items to loot)</rgb>
Talk to Gimli to find out what to do
Spar with Gimli to practice your skill in battle <rgb=#00FF00>Be sure to equip your weapon</rgb>
'We must be quick. I don't know how long Gimli can keep that troll busy before the beast overpowers him.\n\n'Follow me!'
'Your skills are impressive. If you have time, would you do me a favour?'
'Are you ready to prove yourself?  I will go easy on you since you seem to be a young, ambitious dwarf.'
travel_exit (desc)
The Man in grey is Gandalf, an advisor of your lord Thorin Oakenshield
'Back, beast!'
You should walk alongside Gandalf
'Tvistur! Run!'
'Khazâd ai-mênu!'
You have work to do, but Gandalf has more yet to say
'Poor Tvistur!'
'Come to my axe, Troll!'
Thorin departs, leaving his Hall in the care of Gormr Doursmith
'I shall cleave you in two!'
Gormr is in no mood to humour a young miner -- you should get your equipment and get to work
'You face the fury of the dwarves today, Troll!'
Collect your equipment from the satchel by the mine's door
You have collected a weapon, but something is amiss....
Prepare to prove your courage to Gimli
You have practised with Gimli. You must now venture into the mine....
Kapall[mn]
Vitnir[mn]
Monsi[mn]
Foreman Otur[mn]
You should talk to the miners to get them out
There is something strange about this place....
This dwarf is perfectly preserved, and he lies among ruins of an ancient Elf-structure....
Defeated a cave-claw ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'I'll warn you though, Tvistur won't come easily. He's a little hard of hearing....'
Defeated a cave-claw ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'Oi! Tvistur! Come away from there!'
'That satchel there should have some weapons in it that are useful to you.'
'You gather those down this passage; I'll go down the one to the left!'
'I don't think he can even hear me....'
'Glóin, Thorin. I will go ahead to the Shire to find a burglar....'
'Do you want a burglar or not?'
'If there is one thing I know, Thorin Oakenshield, it is my hobbits!'
'This way.'
'I know the perfect one, a hobbit named Bilbo Baggins. If we can convince Thorin, Glóin will agree.'
'Bah! Locked. Let's take the side-path.'
'Question what you will, I have given my answer!'
'It is imperative Bilbo go with them. Their mission will fail if he does not.'
'Oof!'
'Very well. I will warn you I have prepared him.'
'Cursed thing!'
'Good! You, [placeholder], make haste. We must be off!'
'I am glad I arrived when I did. This fellow seemed intent on slaying the both of you.'
'I'm glad Gormr fetched me in time! I do not doubt [placeholder]'s courage, but I think this foe would have overwhelmed you both.'
'Let the Contest of Strength commence!'
'[placeholder], come here! I wish to hear your tale as well.'
Instance: Into the Silver Deep
'When you've got what you need, let me know.'
'Wait...why are you digging around those Elf-ruins?'
'Thorin said to leave them be!'
'You shall trouble us no more!'
'Prepare yourself for battle!'

Thorin and Company are preparing to leave from the Blue Mountains for the ancestral home of Thorin's folk, the Lonely Mountain. You are but a simple miner, but the wizard Gandalf has asked for your assistance.
'Hum dee dum!'
'You are most welcome, Master Dwarf.'
'Doo dee dum.'
'There! That's got it!'
'Wait...what's that shaking?'
Talk to Gandalf
Talk to Gandalf
Talk to Gandalf
'Tvistur, the mine isn't safe!'
'Thorin said to leave them be.'
'Quick! Go get help! I'll draw the troll off! Run!'
'You have proven your worth! Gandalf, we will bring your burglar.'
Ask Gimli what to do next
Convince the miners to leave
Talk to Foreman Otur
Follow Foreman Otur
Talk to Foreman Otur
Follow Foreman Otur
Follow the tunnel opened by Tvistur to try to get to Gimli
'The Shire? A provisioner perhaps, but a burglar?'
Examine the corpse in the Elf-ruins
'But the Shire? There's nothing there but turnip-growers and cooks!'
Defeat cave-claws as you make your way to Gimli and the troll ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'I do not doubt you, Gandalf, but one must question the wisdom....'
Search for Gimli
'How about a friendly wager? A test of strength between myself and your new friend here.'
'If he bests me then we shall bring your burglar.'
'Come here, you oversized sack of stone!'
'Come closer, good Dwarf!'
'I hope this is not an ill omen for my father's journey with Thorin.'
'And to think, I wanted to seek adventure with my father on the way to the Lonely Mountain. Adventure decided to come to me instead!\n\n'I think I've had my fill of it for quite a while....'
A wizened old man stands before you as you go on your way to the Silver Deep Mine.\n\nYou should walk towards him.
'And to think, I wanted to seek adventure with my father on the way to the Lonely Mountain. Adventure decided to come to me instead!\n\n'I think I've had my fill of it for quite a while....'
The wizard Gandalf the Grey, advisor of Thorin Oakenshield, wishes to have a word with you. As Thorin is the master of these halls, you think it best to listen.
'I just know they're going to give me the heaviest load on this trip. I'm not a pack mule, you know!\n\n'Oh, go bother Glóin, why don't you?'
You should accompany Gandalf, for he is a respected advisor of Thorin's.
'This will be a dangerous quest. The combined force of Girion and Thráin could not stop Smaug from laying waste to Dale and robbing us of our home and our wealth.'
Walk with Gandalf while he wishes to have you near him.
'This will be a dangerous quest. The combined force of Girion and Thráin could not stop Smaug from laying waste to Dale and robbing us of our home and our wealth.'
'The dwarves are going to reclaim one of their ancient homes, a mission frought with danger.'
Gormr Doursmith has been appointed Steward of Thorin's Halls while Thorin is away. Now that Thorin and Gandalf have departed, you should speak with Gormr to hear his instructions.
'This is a pompous waste of time. We've a burglar to hire and a dragon to slay.'
'That's why I asked you here today, Master Dwarf.'
A satchel full of equipment lies near the entrance to the Silver Deep Mine.\n\nYou should loot the satchel to equip what you will need for the day's work.
'This is a pompous waste of time. We've a burglar to hire and a dragon to slay.'
'He asks me to advise him, yet he never listens. Wisdom is a curse!'
A satchel full of equipment lies near the entrance to the Silver Deep Mine. You should loot the satchel to equip what you will need for the day's work.
'You need to gather the dwarves in this passage. I'll summon the others in the other branch.'
